info.name: Fluid Density Consideration
info.description:
Studying how to account for density and temperature, instead of always assuming constant density.
 Pressure = density*temperature. Temperature is kinetic energy per particle, density is particles per volume. 

 T*D=P = KE/N*N/V = KE/V

renderpass.name: Image

renderpass.code:
#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texture(iChannel0,(U)/R)
#define B(U) texture(iChannel1,(U)/R)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)
#define D(U) texture(iChannel3,(U)/R)

#define N 20.
#define S -vec4(4)
renderpass.name: Common
Buffer A
Buffer B
Buffer C
Buffer D
